<a id="ResourceFormatSaver"></a>

# ResourceFormatSaver

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Saves a specific resource type to a file.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

The engine can save resources when you do it from the editor, or when you use the [ResourceSaver](ResourceSaver.md) singleton. This is accomplished thanks to multiple **ResourceFormatSaver**\\ s, each handling its own format and called automatically by the engine.

By default, Redot saves resources as ``.tres`` (text-based), ``.res`` (binary) or another built-in format, but you can choose to create your own format by extending this class. Be sure to respect the documented return types and values. You should give it a global class name with ``class_name`` for it to be registered. Like built-in ResourceFormatSavers, it will be called automatically when saving resources of its recognized type(s). You may also implement a [ResourceFormatLoader](ResourceFormatLoader.md).

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__get_recognized_extensions"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **_get_recognized_extensions**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](Resource.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__get_recognized_extensions)

Returns the list of extensions available for saving the resource object, provided it is recognized (see [_recognize()](ResourceFormatSaver.md#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__recognize)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__recognize"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_recognize**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](Resource.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__recognize)

Returns whether the given resource object can be saved by this saver.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__recognize_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **_recognize_path**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](Resource.md), path\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__recognize_path)

Returns ``true`` if this saver handles a given save path and ``false`` otherwise.

If this method is not implemented, the default behavior returns whether the path's extension is within the ones provided by [_get_recognized_extensions()](ResourceFormatSaver.md#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__get_recognized_extensions).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__save"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **_save**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](Resource.md), path\: [String](String.md), flags\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__save)

Saves the given resource object to a file at the target `path`. `flags` is a bitmask composed with [SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) constants.

Returns [@GlobalScope.OK](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_OK) on success, or an [Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) constant in case of failure.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__set_uid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **_set_uid**\ (\ path\: [String](String.md), uid\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#ResourceFormatSaver_private_method__set_uid)

Sets a new UID for the resource at the given `path`. Returns [@GlobalScope.OK](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_OK) on success, or an [Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) constant in case of failure.
